text: Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of the choice ones of God, and an acknowledging of truth that [is] according to piety,
speaker: Narrator

text: upon hope of life age-during, which God, who doth not lie, did promise before times of ages,
speaker: Narrator

text: (and He manifested in proper times His word,) in preaching, which I was entrusted with, according to a charge of God our Saviour,
speaker: Narrator

text: to Titus -- true child according to a common faith: Grace, kindness, peace, from God the Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ our Saviour!
speaker: Narrator

text: For this cause left I thee in Crete, that the things lacking thou mayest arrange, and mayest set down in every city elders, as I did appoint to thee;
speaker: Narrator

text: if any one is blameless, of one wife a husband, having children stedfast, not under accusation of riotous living or insubordinate --
speaker: Narrator

text: for it behoveth the overseer to be blameless, as God's steward, not self-pleased, nor irascible, not given to wine, not a striker, not given to filthy lucre;
speaker: Narrator

text: but a lover of strangers, a lover of good men, sober-minded, righteous, kind, self-controlled,
speaker: Narrator

text: holding -- according to the teaching -- to the stedfast word, that he may be able also to exhort in the sound teaching, and the gainsayers to convict;
speaker: Narrator

text: for there are many both insubordinate, vain-talkers, and mind-deceivers -- especially they of the circumcision --
speaker: Narrator

text: whose mouth it behoveth to stop, who whole households do overturn, teaching what things it behoveth not, for filthy lucre's sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: A certain one of them, a prophet of their own, said -- `Cretans! always liars, evil beasts, lazy bellies!'
speaker: Narrator

text: this testimony is true; for which cause convict them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith,
speaker: Narrator

text: not giving heed to Jewish fables and commands of men, turning themselves away from the truth;
speaker: Narrator

text: all things, indeed, [are] pure to the pure, and to the defiled and unstedfast [is] nothing pure, but of them defiled [are] even the mind and the conscience;
speaker: Narrator

text: God they profess to know, and in the works they deny [Him], being abominable, and disobedient, and unto every good work disapproved.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou -- be speaking what doth become the sound teaching;
speaker: Narrator

text: aged men to be temperate, grave, sober, sound in the faith, in the love, in the endurance;
speaker: Narrator

text: aged women, in like manner, in deportment as doth become sacred persons, not false accusers, to much wine not enslaved, of good things teachers,
speaker: Narrator

text: that they may make the young women sober-minded, to be lovers of [their] husbands, lovers of [their] children,
speaker: Narrator

text: sober, pure, keepers of [their own] houses, good, subject to their own husbands, that the word of God may not be evil spoken of.
speaker: Narrator

text: The younger men, in like manner, be exhorting to be sober-minded;
speaker: Narrator

text: concerning all things thyself showing a pattern of good works; in the teaching uncorruptedness, gravity, incorruptibility,
speaker: Narrator

text: discourse sound, irreprehensible, that he who is of the contrary part may be ashamed, having nothing evil to say concerning you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Servants -- to their own masters [are] to be subject, in all things to be well-pleasing, not gainsaying,
speaker: Narrator

text: not purloining, but showing all good stedfastness, that the teaching of God our Saviour they may adorn in all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the saving grace of God was manifested to all men,
speaker: Narrator

text: teaching us, that denying the impiety and the worldly desires, soberly and righteously and piously we may live in the present age,
speaker: Narrator

text: waiting for the blessed hope and manifestation of the glory of our great God and Saviour Jesus Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: who did give himself for us, that he might ransom us from all lawlessness, and might purify to himself a peculiar people, zealous of good works;
speaker: Narrator

text: these things be speaking, and exhorting, and convicting, with all charge; let no one despise thee!
speaker: Narrator

text: Remind them to be subject to principalities and authorities, to obey rule, unto every good work to be ready,
speaker: Narrator

text: of no one to speak evil, not to be quarrelsome -- gentle, showing all meekness to all men,
speaker: Narrator

text: for we were once -- also we -- thoughtless, disobedient, led astray, serving desires and pleasures manifold, in malice and envy living, odious -- hating one another;
speaker: Narrator

text: and when the kindness and the love to men of God our Saviour did appear
speaker: Narrator

text: (not by works that [are] in righteousness that we did but according to His kindness,) He did save us, through a bathing of regeneration, and a renewing of the Holy Spirit,
speaker: Narrator

text: which He poured upon us richly, through Jesus Christ our Saviour,
speaker: Narrator

text: that having been declared righteous by His grace, heirs we may become according to the hope of life age-during.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stedfast [is] the word; and concerning these things I counsel thee to affirm fully, that they may be thoughtful, to be leading in good works -- who have believed God; these are the good and profitable things to men,
speaker: Narrator

text: and foolish questions, and genealogies, and contentions, and strivings about law, stand away from -- for they are unprofitable and vain.
speaker: Narrator

text: A sectarian man, after a first and second admonition be rejecting,
speaker: Narrator

text: having known that he hath been subverted who [is] such, and doth sin, being self-condemned.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I shall send Artemas unto thee, or Tychicus, be diligent to come unto me to Nicopolis, for there to winter I have determined.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zenas the lawyer and Apollos bring diligently on their way, that nothing to them may be lacking,
speaker: Narrator

text: and let them learn -- ours also -- to be leading in good works to the necessary uses, that they may not be unfruitful.
speaker: Narrator

text: Salute thee do all those with me; salute those loving us in faith; the grace [is] with you all!
speaker: Narrator
